abstract: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley are among banks awaiting federal approval to pay back the funds and escape government controls.
snippet: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley are among banks awaiting federal approval to pay back the funds and escape government controls.
lead_paragraph: It began on Oct. 13, in an atmosphere of panic, with an ultimatum from Washington. Now, the nation’s largest banks see a chance to bring an end to the bailout era.

headline.main: U.S. Weighs How to Let Banks Give Money Back
headline.print_headline: U.S. Weighs How to Let Banks Give Money Back

byline.original: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

abstract: A federal appeals court reinstated a claim by a JPMorgan Chase credit card holder accusing the bank of failing to properly disclose risk factors that allow it to suddenly raise rates.
snippet: A federal appeals court reinstated a claim by a JPMorgan Chase credit card holder accusing the bank of failing to properly disclose risk factors that allow it to suddenly raise rates.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court reinstated a claim by a JPMorgan Chase credit card holder accusing the bank of failing to properly disclose risk factors that allow it to suddenly raise rates, Reuters said.

headline.main: JPMorgan Loses Court Ruling Over Credit Cards

abstract: For the first time in more than a decade, JPMorgan topped Goldman Sachs as the highest-ranking investment bank in Universum USA’s annual survey of college students’ top five places to work.
snippet: For the first time in more than a decade, JPMorgan topped Goldman Sachs as the highest-ranking investment bank in Universum USA’s annual survey of college students’ top five places to work.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon has surpassed Lloyd Blankfein as banking’s big man on campus.

headline.main: In the Quad, at Least, JPMorgan Tops Goldman
